title: Zelda Ward: The Beacon of Brightwood

story.text: Zelda Ward, a recently retired engineer, starts her week at Brightwood Park. While mentoring a group of young students on renewable energy projects, she discovers glowing stones buried beneath a tree. These stones grant her the ability to absorb and manipulate energy.

Zelda uses her new powers discreetly, recharging dead car batteries and helping around the neighborhood. Her heroics stay hidden, until she unknowingly restores power to a stalled ambulance, saving a life and drawing some media attention.

Curious about her powers, Zelda spends the day experimenting. She learns she can also convert her own energy into protective shields. Her mentoring session is interrupted when a minor earthquake hits, and she instinctively uses her shields to protect her students.

The local news starts talking about a mysterious 'Energy Maestro,' captivating the community. Excited, her students start theorizing about the hero's identity, unaware that their mentor is the hero discussed.
Zelda feels the strain of balancing her mentoring and her role as a superhero. She decides to trust her oldest mentee, Jane, with her secret. Jane promises to help Zelda manage her dual life.
With Jane's help, Zelda spends the day crafting a plan to use her powers for larger impacts, such as providing sustainable energy sources to underserved areas of Brightwood.

A major blackout affects the city. Zelda, dubbed as 'The Beacon of Brightwood' by the community, steps out. Channeling all her power, she restores electricity to the city, solidifying her role as a true superhero.

ending: With the city lights back on, Zelda Ward smiled, knowing her journey as both a mentor and a superhero was just beginning.
moral: True power lies in using one's abilities to empower and protect others.
